# [ty] Add warning that docs are autogenerated

---

_@sharkdp_

## Summary

This is a practice I followed on previous projects. Should hopefully further help developers who want to update the documentation?

The big downside is that it's annoying to see this *as a user of the documentation* if you don't open the Markdown file in the browser. But I'd argue that those files don't really follow the original Markdown spirit anyway with all the inline HTML. So maybe it's fine?

---

---

_Review comment by @MichaReiser on `crates/ruff_dev/src/generate_ty_cli_reference.rs`:83 on 2025-05-23 08:22_

It should only very rarely be necessary to edit the generation script itself. Most changes only need changes to `ty/args.rs`, followed by running `cargo dev generate-all`

---

_Review comment by @MichaReiser on `crates/ruff_dev/src/generate_ty_options.rs`:29 on 2025-05-23 08:23_

Same here, users shouldn't have to edit the script. Instead, they should update the documention on the `Options` struct in `ty_project`.

---

_Review comment by @MichaReiser on `crates/ruff_dev/src/generate_ty_rules.rs`:61 on 2025-05-23 08:23_

Same here: Users shouldn't need to change the script. Instead, they should update the metadata of the corresponding `declare_lint!`

---

_@MichaReiser approved on 2025-05-23 08:25_

ty

I think it would be more useful in most cases to hint users toward the source from where the docs are generated in addition (or instead of?) the script generating the docs.
